de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing

Class AddTranscriptionPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
              • de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing.AddTranscriptionPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class AddTranscriptionPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
    A small pane that may used in various locations throughout the application. Its purpose is adding to, editing inside or removing from the database a single TranscriptionItem. The communication with said database is achieved via an instance of AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler handed to the constructor. Consequently, the editing may take pane in an offline, online or any other fashion in which the handler is implemented.
    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddTranscriptionPane

        public AddTranscriptionPane(TranscriptionItem item,
                            AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler inputHandler,
                            boolean showDeleteButton)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        Convenience constructor for the AddTranscriptionPane class. Simply calls AddTranscriptionPane(TranscriptionItem, AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler, DbEditingUserFeedback, boolean) with an empty implementation of UserFeedbackProvider.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to create / edit / remove.
        inputHandler - responsible for communication with the database.
        showDeleteButton - determines whether the deleteButton will be visible or not. In some use cases, deletion is not desired and therefore can effectively be prevented by simply hiding the button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the FXMLLoader throws one.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the FXMLProvider throws one.

      • AddTranscriptionPane

        public AddTranscriptionPane(TranscriptionItem item,
                            AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler inputHandler,
                            DbEditingUserFeedback feedbackProvider,
                            boolean showDeleteButton)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        Constructor for the AddTranscriptionPane class. It will initialise all its components appropriately based on the given parameters. This means that should the TranscriptionItem be empty, for example, the deleteButton will automatically be disabled (as it has obviously not been retrieved from the database). In what way the database is modified depends on the type of AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler that is passed to this constructor.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to create / edit / remove.
        inputHandler - responsible for communication with the database.
        feedbackProvider - any feedback will be sent to this object.
        showDeleteButton - determines whether the deleteButton will be visible or not. In some use cases, deletion is not desired and therefore can effectively be prevented by simply hiding the button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the FXMLLoader throws one.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the FXMLProvider throws one.

    • Method Detail

      • onHotkeyPressed

        private void onHotkeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Should be called whenever the user sends a key to one of the ComboBoxes. For convenience, it will then try to find the next (or first) entry beginning with the typed letter.
        Parameters:
        event - the KeyEvent.

      • onOkButtonPressed

        private void onOkButtonPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Should be called when the okButton is pressed. It will then check whether to create a new or update an existing TranscriptionItem, based on the input.
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent.

      • onKeyPressedOnButton

        private void onKeyPressedOnButton(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Should be called when a key is pressed on either the okButton or deleteButton. The event will then be caught (to avoid any conflict with this pane's parent) the respective button fired manually instead.
        Parameters:
        event - the KeyEvent.

      • deleteItem

        private void deleteItem(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

      • insertData

        private void insertData()
        A convenience method to fill the ComboBoxes and the transcriptionInput with the data from the current transcriptionItemProperty().

      • checkInputValidity

        private void checkInputValidity(java.lang.String input)
        A convenience method to check whether the current input inside the transcriptionInput is a valid phonetic transcription or not. Additionally, it will notify the user about how the evaluation turned out.
        Parameters:
        input - the input String to evaluate.

      • getTranscriptionItem

        public TranscriptionItem getTranscriptionItem()
        A getter for the transcriptionItemProperty()'s value.
        Returns:
        the transcriptionItemProperty's value.
